text: For many restaurants, it's time to rethink everything. https://t.co/q4VGbJj4jS

name: chicagotribune
text: Review: The hour-long “30 Rock” reunion special brought the cast back together via Zoom calls and side plots with impressively high production values as everyone unites for the common cause of praising NBCUniversal and its new streaming service, Peacock. https://t.co/nB1KBn1F1Y

name: chicagotribune
text: Federal prosecutors in Chicago are amassing records related to property tax assessments conducted under former Cook County Assessor Joe Berrios, including a tax break given to Gov. Pritzker after toilets were removed from a Gold Coast mansion he owned. https://t.co/z1ruiarafA

name: chicagotribune
text: ComEd is paying $200 million as part of a federal investigation into a “years-long bribery scheme” as it tried to score wins in the Illinois House controlled by Speaker Michael Madigan, the U.S. Attorney’s office in Chicago announced Friday. https://t.co/F0XCtB0whl

name: chicagotribune
text: Between the time of the city's first truancy officer and today’s clamor to get police out of schools, the relationship between Chicago’s police and the city’s schools has transformed over the years https://t.co/jU6xYLuRRV

text: Take a dog-friendly staycation in Chicago — with good-boy outings and room service included https://t.co/c8Kq1zahHK

text:
How does COVID-19 affect kids? Science has some answers, but doctors say much of the evidence is inconclusive.

“We need to figure out the impact on kids and on the rest of the community.” https://t.co/D2BXlxoNPX

text: The return of Major League Soccer and the Chicago Sting provides a welcome break from the coronavirus sports wasteland, writes columnist @John_Kass https://t.co/1PScS9hCta

text: Want to watch the Chicago Cubs and White Sox “summer camp” exhibitions? Here’s what you need to know. https://t.co/wfpH83zidL

name: chicagotribune
text:
Arthur Watts’ barbecue helped him build a new life after slavery. Nearly 160 years later, his recipes are helping his family build a business.
https://t.co/YZiMMtMNF3

name: chicagotribune
text:
Not to be opened until 2040: Clarion Myles writes a future letter to her great-nephew.

“I’m hoping that in your current life, equality has won over racism, and fairness for all is not a dream or a footnote on a page, but a practiced reality.” https://t.co/TqhH0yJJNx

name: chicagotribune
text:
Rather than making mass transit irrelevant, the pandemic has revealed just how much we need it for our society to function, writes @paul_skoutelas in @ChiTribOpinions

 https://t.co/0NfG7rRdp0

name: chicagotribune
text: As summer heats up, wearing a face mask can boost the chance of skin irritation. Two Chicago skin-care pros tell us how to save your face while staying safe. https://t.co/UNPOhlMfWc

name: chicagotribune
text: John Lewis, whose bloody beating by Alabama state troopers in 1965 helped galvanize popular opposition to racial segregation, and who went on to a long career in Congress, died last night. He was 80. https://t.co/tU5cDzmpm7

name: chicagotribune
text: At least 1,000 people swarmed the Christopher Columbus statue in Grant Park on Friday evening in an attempt to topple it. Some people began throwing fireworks and cans at the police, who in turn struck members of the crowd with batons. https://t.co/5goHVyAozs

name: chicagotribune
text: If you’ve ever sailed aboard a Royal Caribbean cruise, a song lurks deep within your subconscious: a kiddie-style earworm about washing your hands that loops endlessly in the buffet entrance and on in-room TVs. https://t.co/BMGm0ml273

name: chicagotribune
text: The mayor of Portland has demanded President Donald Trump remove militarized federal agents he deployed to the city after some detained people in unmarked cars on streets far from federal property they were sent to protect https://t.co/KTrXh9HFBH

name: chicagotribune
text: House Speaker Michael Madigan drawn closer to federal corruption probe, but many Democrats take wait-and-see approach: “It’s like, ‘Are we there yet? Are we there yet? Are we there yet?' And yet, we never are.” https://t.co/5J8ydVmQLt
